Title: Penne all'Arrabiata
Description: Penne all'arrabbiata (arrabbiata translates into angry), which stems from the Lazio region in central Italy, is a dish comprised of penne pasta and sauce prepared with tomatoes, garlic, and chili peppers.
Instructions: Using a blender, blend the canned tomatoes in a bowl. Lightly brown the garlic and chili pepper in an oiled pan. Be mindful not to overcook the garlic which, when browned too long, gives a bitter taste to the dish. After adding the tomato sauce, season everything with some salt. Cook until the sauce thickens (15-20 mins).

In the meantime, cook penne al dente in boiling salted water. Drain and add to the sauce. Stir the pasta and the sauce thoroughly. Chop some fresh parsley and sprinkle it on top. Stir again, and serve.

Title: Gnocchi alla Sorrentina
Description: Gnocchi alla Sorrentina is an incredible Italian comfort food dish made with soft and light potato gnocchi baked in a rich and delicious tomato sauce with bubbling mozzarella cheese and fresh basil.
Instructions: Pre-heat the oven to 220C.
In a large skillet, add garlic and saute for 1-2 minutes until fragrant but not browned.

Add the canned pomodorini tomatoes and season with salt and pepper and simmer the sauce for 10 minutes breaking up the tomatoes enough so they burst open. Once simmered add half of the mozzarella and basil then stir to combine
Meanwhile, bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook the gnocchi until they float to the surface
Remove the gnocchi from the water and add to the tomato sauce, toss to coat in an ovenproof dish
Top with the remaining mozzarella and bake in the oven for 20 minutes until the cheese is melted and bubbling

Title: Neapolitanish Pizza Base
Description: A Neapolitanish pizza base is a thin, soft, and chewy pizza base that is perfect for a classic Margherita pizza. Perfect for cooking it in a normal oven.
Instructions: In a large bowl, mix the flour and yeast together. Add the water and salt and mix until a dough forms.
Squeeze and turn the dough for 2 minutes until it is smooth and elastic.
Let the dough rest for 30 min.
Streth and pull all corners, and then slap and fold to round the dough
Let the dough rest for another 30 min.
Split the dough into 275g balls. Pull out and fold into the middle 3 times to form a ball. Flip over and roll in your hand until smooth. Pinch the seam close.
Add a little olive oil to a container and put the dough inside
Let the dough rest for 24 hours in the fridge
Take the dough out of the fridge 2 hours before cooking
Flour the surface and press the dough out, but leave edge. Flip it and to it agian. Finally pull and slap tbhe dough to form a thin circle

Title: Baguette
Description: A baguette is a long, thin loaf of French bread that is commonly made from basic lean dough. It is distinguishable by its length and crisp crust.
Instructions: Activate the yeast by mixing it with warm water with some flour. Let it sit for 10 minutes.
Mix the proofed yeast in a bowl with the flour and salt. Add the water and mix until a dough forms.
Let the dough rest for 15 min.
Stretch and fold the dough 4 times, and turn over and let it rest for 25 min. Repeat 4 times.
Test the dough by stretching it out. If it is transparent, it is ready.
Divide into equal 145g portions. Press and strecht the dough into small rectangles. Cover it and let it rest for 15 min.
Fold the top edge of the dough into the center and lightly press on the seam. Roll the ends lightly.
Let the dough rest for 1 hour until they are 1.5x the size.
Preheat the oven to 220C with the tray.
Add a tray of water to the oven to create steam.
Score with long slashes at a 45 degree angle, and lightly water the bread.
Bake for 5 min, and then lightly water the bread some more.
Bake for another 12-15 min until golden brown. Finally let it rest on a wire rack.

Title: Gnocchi
Description: Pillowy-soft, melt-in-your-mouth Italian dumplings made with just three ingredients! These delicate potato gnocchi are crafted using a traditional method that roasts (not boils!) russet potatoes for concentrated flavor, then combines them with a whisper of flour to create a tender, cloud-like texture. Ridged with a fork to cradle rich sauces, they’re boiled to perfection and finished with a quick chill for a flawless bite. Serve them simply tossed in sage-brown butter, marinara, or pesto—or pan-fry for crispy edges!
Instructions: Preheat the oven to 230C
Pierce the potatoes all over with a fork and place them on a wire rack set over a baking sheet. Roast the potatoes in the oven until the insides are fork-tender, about 45-60 min.
Once cool enough to handle, remove the skin and scoop out the flesh into a potato ricer. Rice the potatoes into a thin layer on a work surface to let the steam escape for 5 min

Sprinkle salt over the potatoes and mix it in. Add 75g of flour into a mesh strainer and gently dust over the potatoes. Gently chop and mix the dough. Work the dough as little as possible until it just comes together.
Form the dough into a large log and dust more flour over the log and slice large disks (about 1/4 of the dough)
Gently roll the disk into a thin rope and cut into 1cm pieces. Roll the gnocchi over a fork to create ridges.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook the gnocchi until they float to the surface. Remove the gnocchi with a slotted spoon and place them into an ice bath for 30 sec.
Remove the gnocchi and set on a towel to dry.

Title: Tagliatelle al Ragù alla Bolognese
Description: Tagliatelle al Ragù alla Bolognese is a traditional Italian pasta dish from Bologna, Italy. It is a meat-based sauce that is slow-cooked to develop a rich, deep flavor. The sauce is then tossed with tagliatelle pasta and topped with freshly grated Parmesan cheese.
Instructions: Cook the pancetta in medium heat until melted.
Set the heat to low and add the vegetables. Cook and stir constantly, until soft.
Set the heat to medium and add the meat. Cook and break it up, until browned, about 10 min.
Pour in the wine and reduce until evaporated. Then add the tomato paste and passata.
Pour in 120ml of boiling stock and let it simmer for 2-3 hours. Add milk halfway through the cook time, and make sure it is fully evaporated by the time its done.
Toss with tagliatelle and serve.

Title: Creamy Tomato Mushroom Orzo
Description: This creamy tomato mushroom pasta is perfect since for those late evinings since it is made in a pan and simple.
Ingredients: A tiny pinch of nutmeg (1/8 tsp)
Instructions: Heat the butter in a small pan over medium heat. Add garlic and sauté for 30 sec.
Add sliced mushrooms and a pinch of salt. Cook for 5-7 min, stirring occasionally until browned.
Stir in the tomato paste and let it cook for 1-2 mins. Then add halved cherry tomatoes. Cook another 2-3 mins until they start to break down.
Add the dry orzo directly into the pan. Pour in enough chicken stock to just cover the pasta, stir to combine.
Bring to a simmer and cook uncovered, stirring occasionally. Add more stock or water if needed and cook for 10-12 min.
Add a splash of milk and stir to combine. Let it cook 1-2 min until thickened. Salt and pepper to taste.
Add a small splash of white wine vinegar. Stir taste.
Add the spices and mix well.
Stir in chopped parsley and basil. Save a bit for garnish.
